thread.title: 5 Celeb-Endorsed Designers That You Can Name Drop At The Next Party
thread.title_full: 5 Celeb-Endorsed Designers That You Can Name Drop At The Next Party

title: 5 Celeb-Endorsed Designers That You Can Name Drop At The Next Party
text:
facebook 
The Indian awards season – thanks to Bollywood’s couture-thirsty designers –has officially turned into a pseudo launch pad for off beat designers. For all the Ellie Saabs and Stella McCartneys spotted on the red-carpet, there is a pack of gorgeous gowns showing list-topping promise. The most-awaited night of the year, now, also invites a list of painstakingly-sourced designer labels. 
Here’s all the dope on the designers who our mainstream actresses are wearing, to spell Insta-winning fashion. 1.Yanina Couture 
If Sonam Kapoor’s standing ovation-deserving ballerinas don’t strike a chord, then the actress twinning with bestie Jacqueline Fernandez, in layers of lavender tulle, most definitely will. Yanina Couture is steadily, and rightfully so, becoming a red-carpet regular. Boss-lady Yulia Yanina has two decades of heavy-duty couture behind her. And, we’re behind her ethereal wedding aisle-worthy creations, 100 percent. A photo posted by sonamkapoor (@sonamkapoor) on Dec 21, 2016 at 1:50pm PST A photo posted by Jacqueline Fernandez (@jacquelinef143) on Dec 19, 2016 at 7:33am PST A photo posted by Rhea Kapoor (@rheakapoor) on Jan 14, 2017 at 7:38am PST 2.Ali Younes Couture 
Jacqueline Fernandez on the red carpet is a blessing to humanity. Her posing antics aside, the trailing Ali Younes gown that she recently walked in, headed straight to our secret Pinterest boards. That and the black form-fitting one, worn by Sridevi. Stylist Tanya Ghavri (responsible for all these looks) is, obviously, smitten with the Kuwait-based label. Looking at their Ellie Saab-meets-Naeem Khan sensibility, we aren’t surprised why. A photo posted by Edition Pakistan (@edition.pk) on Jan 14, 2017 at 8:13am PST A photo posted by Bollywood4You (@bollywood4you) on Jan 19, 2017 at 2:36pm PST 3.Mark Bumgarner 
We have Parineeti Chopra’s all-too-pink Filmfare appearance to thank for this soon to-be Indian favourite. That Mark Bumgarner is a former Formula racer is wildly unbelievable. Thank God for the fashion world, the Filipino designer took a detour and his designs were lapped up by the rich and famous. A photo posted by Parineeti Chopra (@parineetichopra) on Jan 14, 2017 at 7:49am PST 4.Johanna Ortiz 
The Columbian designer has been on the global fashion for her decidedly dramatic silhouettes. Recently, an outfit by the designer was chosen by Deepika Padukone while on her promotional tour. The too-cool-for-a-blazer suit was a master class in how suits should be worn in 2017 - Sans the lapels and with plunging necklines. A photo posted by Shaleena (@shaleenanathani) on Jan 5, 2017 at 6:21pm PST 5.Peter Langner 
Tamannah Bhatia’s foray into metallic ball-gowns is the reason Peter Langner’s designs have found an Indian fan base. After having learnt from the masters at Christian Dior, Emanuel Ungaro, Guy LaRoche, and Christian Lacroix, the German designer has a store in Milan to his name. We have our eyes dead set on this new age bride’s go-to-couturier. A photo posted by Sanjana Batra (@sanjanabatra) on Jan 13, 2017 at 10:54pm PST A photo posted by Sanjana Batra (@sanjanabatra) on Dec 19, 2016 at 8:17am PST
